citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility is currently treating animal enclosures with Ag Lime for possible mites but has not communicated this
treatment with the Attending Veterinarian. Failure to have frequent and direct communication with the attending
veterinarian on treatments may result in inadequate or incorrect treatment of the animals and their well-being may suffer.
The facility must have frequent and direct communication so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal
health, behavior, and well-being can be evaluated by the attending veterinarian.
To be corrected by: 23-August-2024.

One striped skunk was moved to an outdoor enclosure not surrounded by a 6 foot perimeter fence. There is a 3 foot
public barrier around the enclosure but this species requires at least a 6 foot perimeter fence. Perimeter fences are
important to prevent contact or entry to the enclosure by predators and unauthorized persons. This could potentially
cause injury or illness to the animals. The facility must have a perimeter fence appropriate for the species being housed or
have an approved variance by the Administrator.
To be corrected by: 28-August-2024

The facility does not have a pest control program for burrowing mammals. There is one hole approximately 18 inches
wide and 4 inches tall going under a building inside the deer enclosure, likely made by a mammalian pest. The hole is
present right next to the two deer's only water source. The mammalian pest burrows may cause injury to the animals if a
deer were to step into a hole or burrow. A safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian
and mammalian pests shall be established and maintained.
To be corrected by: 28-August-2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility is currently treating animal enclosures with Ag Lime for possible mites but has not communicated this 
treatment with the Attending Veterinarian. Failure to have frequent and direct communication with the attending 
veterinarian on treatments may result in inadequate or incorrect treatment of the animals and their well-being may suffer. 
The facility must have frequent and direct communication so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal 
health, behavior, and well-being can be evaluated by the attending veterinarian.  
To be corrected by: 23-August-2024. 
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
One striped skunk was moved to an outdoor enclosure not surrounded by a 6 foot perimeter fence. There is a 3 foot 
public barrier around the enclosure but this species requires at least a 6 foot perimeter fence. Perimeter fences are 
important to prevent contact or entry to the enclosure by predators and unauthorized persons. This could potentially 
cause injury or illness to the animals. The facility must have a perimeter fence appropriate for the species being housed or 
have an approved variance by the Administrator. 
To be corrected by: 28-August-2024 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
The facility does not have a pest control program for burrowing mammals. There is one hole approximately 18 inches 
wide and 4 inches tall going under a building inside the deer enclosure, likely made by a mammalian pest. The hole is 
present right next to the two deer's only water source. The mammalian pest burrows may cause injury to the animals if a 
deer were to step into a hole or burrow. A safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian 
and mammalian pests shall be established and maintained. 
To be corrected by: 28-August-2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
